title: Wind drake
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For a list of all lesser dragons, see [list of dragons](/List_of_dragons#Lesser_Dragons "List of dragons").*

| wind drake k [![Wind drake.png](/images/b/b7/Wind_drake.png)](/File:Wind_drake.png) |                                                                                    |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [HP](/Hit_points "Hit points")                                                      | 39-80                                                                              |
| [HD](/Hit_dice "Hit dice")                                                          | 8                                                                                  |
| [XP](/XP "XP")                                                                      | 288                                                                                |
| [Speed](/Monster_speed "Monster speed")                                             | 12                                                                                 |
| [AC](/Armour_class "Armour class")                                                  | 3                                                                                  |
| [EV](/Evasion "Evasion")                                                            | 14                                                                                 |
| [Will](/Willpower "Willpower")                                                      | 40                                                                                 |
| Attack1                                                                             | 12 ([bite](/Attack_type "Attack type"): [plain](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour")) |
| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                             | None                                                                               |
| [Vulnerabilities](/Vulnerability "Vulnerability")                                   | None                                                                               |
| [Habitat](/Habitat "Habitat")                                                       | Land                                                                               |
| [Intelligence](/Monster_intelligence "Monster intelligence")                        | [Animal](/Category:Animal_intelligence "Category:Animal intelligence")             |
| [Uses](/Item_usage "Item usage")                                                    | [Uses nothing](/Category:Uses_nothing "Category:Uses nothing")                     |
| [Holiness](/Holiness "Holiness")                                                    | [Natural](/Category:Natural_holiness "Category:Natural holiness")                  |
| [Size](/Size "Size")                                                                | [Large](/Category:Large_monsters "Category:Large monsters")                        |
| [Type](/Type "Type")                                                                | drake, wind drake                                                                  |
| Flags                                                                               | [Flying](/Flying "Flying") [Warm-blooded](/Blood_temperature "Blood temperature")  |

|   |                                                                                                                                                              |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | A small but powerful dragon, particularly adept amongst its kin at manipulating the currents of air that surround it. It can exhale powerful blasts of wind. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Wind drakes** are one of the weaker [lesser dragons](/List_of_dragons#Lesser_Dragons "List of dragons"), but they are still capable of irritating and injuring adventurers. Their [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") can pummel you with [smite-targeted](/Smite-targeted "Smite-targeted") wind damage or push you around the battlefield, and they have a naturally-occurring [Repel Missiles](/Repel_Missiles "Repel Missiles") effect at all times. They can be encountered in the [Shoals](/Shoals "Shoals"), some of [The Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair") endings, and can be summoned by enemies with the [Summon Drakes](/Summon_Drakes "Summon Drakes") spell.

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                    |                                                                                                           |
| :---------- | -------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Wind Blast](/Wind_Blast "Wind Blast")             | [Natural flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags"), [Breath flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Airstrike](/Airstrike "Airstrike") (2d(7-23))     | [Natural flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")                                                      |
| Slot3       | [Repel Missiles](/Repel_Missiles "Repel Missiles") | [Natural flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")                                                      |

## Tips & Tricks

- You should treat Airstrike like a stronger [Smiting](/Smiting "Smiting"). It checks [AC](/AC "AC"), but deals *much* more damage in an open area. Not great when Shoals is filled with open areas.
  - Specifically: for every empty tile adjacent to you, Airstrike deals more damage. Surrounding yourself with [summons](/Summon "Summon"), or standing adjacent to a wall, will decrease the amount of empty spaces available.

- Wind drakes make [stairs](/Stairs "Stairs") much less reliable, since Wind Blast can knock you back, interrupting the stair. If a wind drake is in view, don't attempt to [stair dance](/Stair_dance "Stair dance"), and don't expect stairs to be a reliable way of escape.

- Repel Missiles will greatly reduce the accuracy of ranged attacks, so it can be difficult for [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons") or certain spells to hit.

  - For any character, using a [wand of flame](/Wand_of_flame "Wand of flame") over water can be a decent option. It creates [steam](/Steam "Steam"), which can kill the drake after a couple puffs of flame. For [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic") specialists, a [Fireball](/Fireball "Fireball") or so is much more effective.
  - Attacks that never miss, such as your own [Airstrike](/Airstrike "Airstrike"), obviously ignore RMsl.
  - Wind drakes have low [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") for this stage of the game, so status [wands](/Wand "Wand") can all work well.
  - [Yara's Violent Unravelling](/Yara%27s_Violent_Unravelling "Yara's Violent Unravelling") or a [wand of quicksilver](/Wand_of_quicksilver "Wand of quicksilver") (if it hits) will dispel the status, forcing monsters to activate it again.

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), the open space bonus for Airstrike was much weaker.
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Airstrike dealt extra damage to [flying](/Flying "Flying") targets.
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), wind drakes had a permanent [Deflect Missiles](/Deflect_Missiles "Deflect Missiles") effect instead of [Repel Missiles](/Repel_Missiles "Repel Missiles").
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), they had [wind resistance](/Category:Wind_resistance "Category:Wind resistance") and were immune to [Airstrike](/Airstrike "Airstrike") and [Tornado](/Tornado "Tornado").
- Wind drakes were added in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14").
html:
Wind drake

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all lesser dragons, see list of dragons.

wind drake k 
HP 39-80
HD 8
XP 288
Speed 12
AC 3
EV 14
Will 40
Attack1 12 (bite: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Large
Type drake, wind drake
Flags Flying
Warm-blooded
A small but powerful dragon, particularly adept amongst its kin at manipulating the currents of air that surround it. It can exhale powerful blasts of wind.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Wind drakes are one of the weaker lesser dragons, but they are still capable of irritating and injuring adventurers. Their Air Magic can pummel you with smite-targeted wind damage or push you around the battlefield, and they have a naturally-occurring Repel Missiles effect at all times. They can be encountered in the Shoals, some of The Lair endings, and can be summoned by enemies with the Summon Drakes spell.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Wind Blast Natural flag,
Breath flag
Slot2 Airstrike (2d(7-23)) Natural flag
Slot3 Repel Missiles Natural flag

Tips & Tricks

  • You should treat Airstrike like a stronger Smiting. It checks AC, but deals much more damage in an open area. Not great when Shoals is filled with open areas.
    • Specifically: for every empty tile adjacent to you, Airstrike deals more damage. Surrounding yourself with summons, or standing adjacent to a wall, will decrease the amount of empty spaces available.
  • Wind drakes make stairs much less reliable, since Wind Blast can knock you back, interrupting the stair. If a wind drake is in view, don't attempt to stair dance, and don't expect stairs to be a reliable way of escape.
  • Repel Missiles will greatly reduce the accuracy of ranged attacks, so it can be difficult for Ranged Weapons or certain spells to hit.
    • For any character, using a wand of flame over water can be a decent option. It creates steam, which can kill the drake after a couple puffs of flame. For Fire Magic specialists, a Fireball or so is much more effective.
    • Attacks that never miss, such as your own Airstrike, obviously ignore RMsl.
    • Wind drakes have low willpower for this stage of the game, so status wands can all work well.
    • Yara's Violent Unravelling or a wand of quicksilver (if it hits) will dispel the status, forcing monsters to activate it again.

History

  • Prior to 0.29, the open space bonus for Airstrike was much weaker.
  • Prior to 0.27, Airstrike dealt extra damage to flying targets.
  • Prior to 0.25, wind drakes had a permanent Deflect Missiles effect instead of Repel Missiles.
  • Prior to 0.19, they had wind resistance and were immune to Airstrike and Tornado.
  • Wind drakes were added in 0.14.

rawPage:
{{version030}}
''For a list of all lesser dragons, see [[list of dragons#Lesser Dragons|list of dragons]].''
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Wind drakes''' are one of the weaker [[list of dragons#Lesser Dragons|lesser dragons]], but they are still capable of irritating and injuring adventurers. Their [[Air Magic]] can pummel you with [[smite-targeted]] wind damage or push you around the battlefield, and they have a naturally-occurring [[Repel Missiles]] effect at all times. They can be encountered in the [[Shoals]], some of [[The Lair]] endings, and can be summoned by enemies with the [[Summon Drakes]] spell.

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*You should treat Airstrike like a stronger [[Smiting]]. It checks [[AC]], but deals ''much'' more damage in an open area. Not great when Shoals is filled with open areas.
**Specifically: for every empty tile adjacent to you, Airstrike deals more damage. Surrounding yourself with [[summon]]s, or standing adjacent to a wall, will decrease the amount of empty spaces available.
*Wind drakes make [[stairs]] much less reliable, since Wind Blast can knock you back, interrupting the stair. If a wind drake is in view, don't attempt to [[stair dance]], and don't expect stairs to be a reliable way of escape.
*Repel Missiles will greatly reduce the accuracy of ranged attacks, so it can be difficult for [[Ranged Weapons]] or certain spells to hit.
**For any character, using a [[wand of flame]] over water can be a decent option. It creates [[steam]], which can kill the drake after a couple puffs of flame. For [[Fire Magic]] specialists, a [[Fireball]] or so is much more effective.
**Attacks that never miss, such as your own [[Airstrike]], obviously ignore RMsl.
**Wind drakes have low [[willpower]] for this stage of the game, so status [[wand]]s can all work well.
**[[Yara's Violent Unravelling]] or a [[wand of quicksilver]] (if it hits) will dispel the status, forcing monsters to activate it again.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.29]], the open space bonus for Airstrike was much weaker.
*Prior to [[0.27]], Airstrike dealt extra damage to [[flying]] targets.
*Prior to [[0.25]], wind drakes had a permanent [[Deflect Missiles]] effect instead of [[Repel Missiles]].
*Prior to [[0.19]], they had [[:Category:Wind_resistance|wind resistance]] and were immune to [[Airstrike]] and [[Tornado]].
*Wind drakes were added in [[0.14]].
